title: CISCO Critical Vulnerability
description: On December 16th, CISCO updated its security advisory related to CVE-2021-44228 affecting many of its products. While this CVE affects the Java logging library log4j, all products using this library are vulnerable to at least Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution.
content_markdown:
---
title: 'CISCO CriticalÂ Vulnerability'
version: '1.0'
number: '2021-074'
date: 'December 18, 2021'
---

_History:_

* _18/12/2021 --- v1.0 -- Initial publication_

# Summary

On December 16th, CISCO updated its security advisory related to CVE-2021-44228 affecting many of its products [1]. While this CVE affects the Java logging library log4j, all products using this library are vulnerable to _at least_ Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution [2].

# Technical Details

The vulnerability exists in the Java logging library log4j. An unauthenticated remote attacker might exploit this vulnerability by sending specially crafted content to the application to execute malicious code on the server [2].

# Affected products and Fixed Release

# Recommendations

CERT-EU recommends applying the patches, or upgrading the products as soon as possible. Refer to the table in [Affected products and Fixed Release] section and to details provided by CISCO in [1] to find the fixed release of each product.

# References

[1] <https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-apache-log4j-qRuKNEbd>

[2] <https://media.cert.europa.eu/static/SecurityAdvisories/2021/CERT-EU-SA2021-067.pdf>
